Questions.Question: What year was the first version of the PlayStation console released?
Questions.Explanation: The original PlayStation console was released in December 1994.

Questions.Question: Which company released the first commercially successful video game console?
Questions.Explanation: The Magnavox Odyssey, released in 1972, is considered the first successful home video game console.

Questions.Question: What is the resolution of standard high-definition (HD) in gaming?
Questions.Explanation: Standard high-definition (HD) resolution is typically 1280x720 pixels, commonly referred to as 720p.

Questions.Question: Which gaming company is known for creating the 'Halo' franchise?
Questions.Explanation: The 'Halo' series was developed by Bungie and published by Microsoft Game Studios.

Questions.Question: In what year was the popular game 'Minecraft' officially released to the public?
Questions.Explanation: Minecraft was officially released on November 18, 2011, following a period of beta testing.

Questions.Question: Which of these is not a famous video game voice actor?
Questions.Explanation: James Cameron is a renowned filmmaker, not a video game voice actor.

Questions.Question: What is the name of the AI in the game 'Portal'?
Questions.Explanation: In the 'Portal' game series, GLaDOS (Genetic Lifeform and Disk Operating System) is the primary antagonist and AI.

Questions.Question: Which of these consoles was the first to feature a CD-ROM drive?
Questions.Explanation: The TurboGrafx-16, released in 1989, was the first console to use a CD-ROM peripheral for games.

Questions.Question: What was the best-selling game on the Nintendo 64 console?
FalseAnswer: The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time
Questions.Explanation: Super Mario 64, released alongside the Nintendo 64 in 1996, remains the best-selling game for the console.

Questions.Question: What does 'FPS' stand for in the context of gaming?
Questions.Explanation: FPS in gaming refers to the number of frames displayed per second, representing the smoothness of motion in the game visuals.

Questions.Question: Which of these gaming platforms is developed by Valve Corporation?
Questions.Explanation: Steam is a digital distribution platform developed by Valve Corporation, offering a wide range of games to users.

Questions.Question: What was the first arcade video game to feature scrolling levels?
Questions.Explanation: Released in 1981, 'Defender' was the first arcade game to feature a horizontally scrolling playfield, rather than a single static screen.

Questions.Question: Which gaming console was originally known as the 'Revolution' during its development?
Questions.Explanation: The Nintendo Wii was initially code-named 'Revolution' before its official release as the Wii console.

Questions.Question: What is the name of the virtual reality headset developed by Sony Interactive Entertainment?
Questions.Explanation: PlayStation VR, designed for the PlayStation 4 console, is a virtual reality headset developed by Sony Interactive Entertainment.

Questions.Question: Which character is the primary antagonist in the 'Half-Life' game series?
Questions.Explanation: The G-Man is a mysterious character who appears to control the events in the 'Half-Life' series, often serving as the primary antagonist.

Questions.Question: Which game engine was used to develop 'Unreal Tournament' and 'Gears of War'?
Questions.Explanation: The Unreal Engine, developed by Epic Games, has been used to create popular games such as 'Unreal Tournament' and 'Gears of War.'

Questions.Question: What is the main resource used as currency in 'World of Warcraft'?
Questions.Explanation: Gold is the primary in-game currency used for trading, purchasing items, and engaging in economic activities within the virtual world of 'World of Warcraft.'

Questions.Question: Which gaming console was the first to use optical discs as its primary storage medium?
Questions.Explanation: The Sega Saturn, released in 1994, was the first gaming console to use optical discs as the primary medium for game storage.

Questions.Question: What is the name of the AI assistant in the game 'Destiny'?
Questions.Explanation: The AI assistant in the game 'Destiny' is called Ghost, which provides guidance and support to the player throughout the game.
